Hello everyone, something not too related. I want a task manager to manage my personal projects better and I am between Asana and Pivotal. 

On one hand I already use Asana at work so it would be easy to use for my personal projects, on the other Pivotal looks quite cool and simpler for personal projects.

Does anyone has any suggestions between these two or maybe any other one?
<@U09T8SFG8>: You should try Trello, it is more simple and flexible then those two.
Oh yes Trello, I completely forgot about that
Is there an open source alternative to trello?
Is there a _good_ open source alternative to trello?
or get a private github repo and use waffle :smile:
I’ve tried this one <https://www.breeze.pm/>, but only working with bitbucket right now

text: do you guys know of a guide that covers how to make custom views grow to fill their parent? we currently have this in place but it does it by incrementally increasing height and length until it overflows its parent. it’s not performant and when it’s in fragments & pager, the swiping to switch fragments is impacted
sure. set layout_width or height depending on which dimension you want to stretch. layout_weight gives that view the remaining screen area once the rest of the widgets have been measured
its a custom widget that draws on a canvas and needs to stay square. I forget why we did it with incrementally growing, but Ill try to do it with weights and 0dp height/width
yeah that’s the caveat. needs to stay square
how are you doing the square part? overriding onMeasure and setting the dimensions to be the same?
override onMeasure, set the width or height to whichever is less?

anyone able to connect to a web server on local internet from an android device? i'm hosting a linux VM in virtualbox, and i'm able to connect from my host machine, but not my nexus 5 on the same network because of DNS lookup failure
but i'm not very experienced in server administration or anything so just checking i'm not doing something dumb
yup, <@U0546QERR> it’s definitely a problem of VM network configuration
I do that, sorta - using something like charles proxy from my device
hmm alrighty. i think google has some instructions on the emulator page around DNS issues
going to try it out later

In previous builds we had turned it off when using annotation processors, but it turns out there are still some bugs where resource constant field...

attachments.title: public class ButtonBehavior extends CoordinatorLayout.Behavior {         - Pastebin.com
attachments.fallback: Pastebin: public class ButtonBehavior extends CoordinatorLayout.Behavior {         - Pastebin.com

text:
This move a button up when a snackbar comes up, adjusting it can’t be so bad. But for example here:
``` public boolean layoutDependsOn(CoordinatorLayout parent, Button child, View dependency)```
child —> direct child of your CoordinatorLayout, and dependency is what made the change to the layout.
So if you have everything in a LinLayout under the Coordinator view, it wont’t work.
You could just use the updateButtonTranslationForSnackbar and adjust it to wherever your code makes the button visible to do the translation for your buttons
